intro: Senecio pamplonensis, commonly known as the Pamplona groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Spain. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Senecio pamplonensis is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions.
